DOCNAME: CASE OF KARATAY AND OTHERS v. TURKEY
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE , DATE and DATE respectively and live in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE , a textile company in ORG filed a petition with the office of ORG , complaining about the fraudulent acts of PERSON , the first applicant .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG requested ORG to issue an arrest warrant , for all CARDINAL applicants , on suspicion of having committed fraud . On DATE the public prosecutor filed an indictment with the same court , charging the applicants and CARDINAL others with embezzlement under Articles CARDINAL of LAW .

CARDINAL . On DATE the third applicant was arrested and placed in detention at FAC , by the judge at ORG . The judge did not take his statements , but merely informed the applicant of the charges against him and noted his personal data .

CARDINAL . On DATE , considering the state of the evidence and the nature of the offence , ORG ordered the continuation of the third applicant 's detention on remand in his absence and demanded his presence for the following hearing .
CARDINAL . In a letter dated DATE , addressed to ORG the third applicant requested to be released pending trial .

CARDINAL . At the hearings of DATE and DATE the applicant was not brought before the court . The court ordered the third applicant 's continued detention on remand reiterating the same reasoning . It further requested his transfer from FAC to FAC in order to facilitate his presence before the court . In the meantime , ORG informed ORG that the first and second applicants had been arrested and detained on remand on DATE and CARDINAL DATE , respectively .
CARDINAL . NORP In a letter dated DATE , addressed to ORG the first applicant confessed to his guilt .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants ' lawyer , who was present before ORG for the first time , requested the applicants ' release pending trial . Taking into consideration the state of the evidence and the nature of the offence , ORG dismissed the lawyer 's request , and requested the applicants ' transfer to ORG .

CARDINAL . At the same hearing the applicants ' lawyer requested the court not to transfer the third applicant from CARDINAL prison to another due to his health problems . Subsequently , the court sent a letter rogatory to ORG in order to take the third applicant 's statements .

CARDINAL . At the hearings of CARDINAL DATE and DATE the court repeated its previous requests concerning the first and second applicants ' transfer to the court and ordered , once again , the continuation of all CARDINAL applicants ' detention on remand .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants ' lawyer complained before the court that although the applicants had been detained on remand for quite some time their statements had still not been taken by the court . He argued that this situation was in breach of the applicants ' rights guaranteed under the Convention . Furthermore , in view of the length of their detention and the health problems of the third applicant , he requested the applicants ' release pending trial . The court dismissed the lawyer 's request in view of the state of the evidence and the nature of the offence . It also reiterated its order to transfer all CARDINAL applicants to ORG .

CARDINAL . At the hearing of DATE the applicants ' lawyer maintained that the reason the prison authorities were not transferring the applicants to the PERSON prison was because fuel expenses were not covered by the budget . He maintained that if the applicants are released , he would personally ensure the applicants ' presence before the court . The court decided to send a letter rogatory to ORG to take the applicants ' statements and then to release them .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants gave their statements before ORG . The first applicant confessed to his guilt , while the others refuted the allegations . The court ordered their release pending trial as requested by ORG , in its decision dated DATE .
CARDINAL . NORP The textile company filed another complaint with the office of ORG , in relation to the first and the third applicants , regarding the same incident .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG filed an indictment against the first and the third applicants for embezzlement . On DATE the court decided that it lacked jurisdiction to examine the case and sent the case file to ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of First Instance took the applicants ' statements by way of rogatory letter issued by ORG . The applicants alleged that they were not aware of the fact that a second case had been brought against them , at the time they gave these statements

CARDINAL . At the hearing of DATE ORG acquitted the third applicant due to lack of evidence and found the first applicant guilty as charged and sentenced him to DATE and DATE imprisonment . Both the applicants and their lawyers were informed of the second case when the decision of DATE was notified to them .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants appealed against the decision of ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant was arrested and subsequently imprisoned in accordance with the decision dated DATE . On DATE ORG quashed the decision of the first instance court .

CARDINAL . When the case was resumed before the first instance court , the applicants ' lawyer requested to join this case with the CARDINAL pending before ORG , as they concerned the same subject matter . Furthermore , he requested the first applicant 's release pending trial . ORG refused the lawyer 's request to release the applicant in view of the state of the evidence and the nature of the offence .
CARDINAL . On DATE the CARDINAL cases were joined before ORG .

CARDINAL . At the hearings held on DATE , DATE and CARDINAL DATE the court ordered the continuation of the first applicant 's detention on remand on account of the state of evidence and the seriousness of the charges , and taking into account the date of his arrest .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court ordered his release pending trial .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG decided to acquit the second and third applicants and convicted the first applicant . It sentenced him to DATE and DATE imprisonment .
CARDINAL . Following the first applicant 's appeal , the case is pending before ORG .
